Cho (a unit of length in old Japanese system of weights and measures)

sen.j: 町（ちょう）は尺貫法での長さ（距離）または面積の単位である。
sen.e: Cho is a unit of length (distance) or area in shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures).

sen.j: 条里制においては6尺を1歩 (尺貫法)として60歩を1町としていたが、太閤検地の際に6尺3寸を1間とする60間となり、後に6尺を1間とする60間となった。
sen.e: In Jorisei (system of land subdivision in ancient Japan), 6 shaku (unit of distance approximately equal to 30.3 cm) was 1 bu (unit of land measurement) and 60 bu made up 1 cho: however, at Taiko kenchi (the land survey by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI), 1 cho became 60 ken (unit of distance, approximately 1.818m) with 1 ken being 6 shaku and 3 sun (unit of distance, approximately 3.03 cm) but later with 1 ken equal to 6 shaku.
